data: PED ONCS AMB Fever qdaily for 2 day (Day of Treatment)
Admit/Transfer/Discharge
B.C Children's Hospital Fever and Neutropenia Guidelines
Patient Care
Weight
once
Vital Signs
q4h interval
Pulse Oximetry
q4h interval
Central Venous Catheter Care
If patient has Central Venous Catheter, access all lumens / ports and draw bloodwork
Continuous Infusions
Bolus Fluids

sodium chloride 0.9% IV bolus:    1) Repeat in 20 mL/kg increments up to 60 mL/kg     2) If no response after bolus #2 of sodium chloride 0.9%, consider initiation of inotropes    3) If 60 mL/kg of crystalloid fluid is given, then mandatory critical care consult
sodium chloride 0.9% (NS) bolus
20 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 5 minute, drug form: bag
20 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 15 minute, drug form: bag
20 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 30 minute, drug form: bag
20 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 60 minute, drug form: bag
Maintenance Fluids
sodium chloride 0.9% (NS) continuous infusion
mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
dextrose 5%-sodium chloride 0.9% (D5NS) continuous infusion
mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
KCL 20 mmol/L-dextrose 5%-sodium chloride 0.9% continuous infusion
mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
Medications
Commence antibiotics as per Fever and Neutropenia Guidelines immediately after bloodwork
Consider dosage adjustments for renal impairment
Do not delay antmicrobial administration if bloodwork delayed
Communication Order
Commence antimicrobials as per Fever and Neutropenia Guidelines immediately after blood work drawn.  Do not delay antimicrobial administration if bloodwork delayed
levoFLOXacin
10 mg/kg, PO, q12h interval, drug form: oral liq
10 mg/kg, PO, q12h interval, drug form: tab
10 mg/kg, PO, once, drug form: oral liq
10 mg/kg, PO, once, drug form: tab
ceftriaxone
100 mg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj.
